sn35.166:4.1: Then a mendicant went up to the Buddha …
sn35.166:4.3: “Sir, how does one know and see so that identity view is given up?”
sn35.166:4.4: “Mendicant, knowing and seeing the eye, sights, eye consciousness, and eye contact as suffering, wrong view is given up. …
sn35.166:4.8: And also knowing and seeing the pleasant, painful, or neutral feeling that arises conditioned by mind contact as suffering, wrong view is given up.
sn35.166:4.9: This is how to know and see so that identity view is given up.”
